data.title: Hope on over
data.text: The burgers well well crafted and the atmosphere was just great. I must also point out that the beer that matches the feel of this place makes for a great experience.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Fairly new to the clarksville area and we'll worth the visit for fresh made pastry and coffee. A little pricey but worth it

data.title: Getting better, beware the $12 burger
data.text: The place is nice, people friendly enough, but it's the menu that I like the best. My wife loves the grilled cheese heaven made with 7 types of cheese, I like the concept of the easy over burger unfortunately the burger was very dry (over cooked) the bacon delicious but had a chewing edge that was like rubber. For the price I expect better, I mentioned it to the staff, but it was like oh, dry Huh. That'le be $12.00 bro. I had a better lunch experience. We'll try em again I want to try all of a Grill cheese heaven for myself.

data.title: Great Service!!  Nice beer selection!!
data.text: LOVED the fried onion appitizer!!  Cuban sandwich was good. The best part for me was their service.  I think 3 different people asked me if I needed anything multiple times!!  Impressive beer options!  I would return no doubt.  Nice to see this business care about their customers!!  👍🏻

data.title: Awesome Little Place
data.text: The Vineyard Salad and Cuban are two of the most satisfying meals I've ever had. I thoroughly enjoyed the environment and service. I would recommend this to anyone passing through! I am one very happy visitor. 😄

data.title: What a surprise
data.text:
You would never guess where it's located that it's a very good place to eat. The waitress was excellent. The food was very good. Had lunch the whole experience was excellent.  Try the pineapple cider out of this 
world

data.title: Best Burger Ever!!!!
data.text: Great little place, cool atmosphere and fantabulous food!!!! I had The Hopyard burgher and it was by far the best burger I've ever had!!!! My boyfriend had The Cuban and the pork was some of the best either one of us has ever had!!! We will definitely be back!!!!

data.title: Worth the trip downtown for lunch when traveling
data.text:
We stopped by for lunch on the way back from Nashville.  We saw good reviews on tripadvisor, so we decided to try it out.
Cute little diner/bar right downtown.  Our hostess and server were both very friendly.
I ordered the Market Fresh Wrap and a salad with vinaigrette dressing.
The wrap was super tasty.  The homemade hummus was off the charts.  
My mom had the chicken salad sandwich which comes on a cute little bun.  She said it was made with craisins and nuts.  She said it was okay, but not as flavorful as she would have liked.  It came with truffle fries that were good, if you like the truffle flavor.  
My stepdad had the Rueben burger, which has a wonderful homemade slaw on top.  He loved it and he also loved the truffle fries.
That along with one tea and a coke was around $37.00, so it wasn't a cheap lunch. 
But I still recommend it.  
Nice atmosphere and nice place.

data.title: Great find - kids welcome
data.text: We stopped here for lunch on our way to Nashville.  What a great little lucky find.  Wonderful service, exceptional food and a good vibe with the Euros playing on the TVs (wouldn't get that in Central Illinois).  Clarksville also looked like a neat town to check out if I didn't have 2 crabby kids in tow.

data.title: Hops Road a hit with me.
data.text: Stopped in on a Thursday lunch. School out so not crowded. Service was quick, attentive and excellent. Had a delicious chicken salad on bun, Maple Bacon Fries (to die for) and a Mayday Brewery Seasonal, Old Salem Sour, which was wonderful. Excellent selection of craft beers and good pub grub. I shall return!

data.title: Perfect Place
data.text: Best place to grab a delicious meal and choose from a great variety of craft beers. Incredible folks!

data.title: Great little joint!
data.text:
I guess the best compliment I can give this place is to say I can't wait to go again, so I can try more menu items.
I met some friends here, and we all really enjoyed what we had. We selected the cheddar balls as an app, and they were great (as was the dipping sauce). I had a Reuben burger which was amazing, and the Parmesan truffle fries were so tasty!! I wasn't even starving when I got there, but I couldn't stop eating! One person had the rocky top, which they raved about. We all really enjoyed it. Service was good, beer was good...had a great time!

user_location.name: Kansas by way of US Army

data.title: Amazingly unique!
data.text: We were traveling through from Nashville to So IL and saw this gem on Trip Advisor. We decided to give it a try and we were NOT disappointed! The service is awesome and the food is excellent! Must try: Gouda mac & cheese bites! Burgers are huge and delicious! You cannot go wrong here!

data.title: Perfect for the after museum lunch
data.text: Just around the corner (OK, 2 corners) from the Custom House Museum; there was not much open on a Saturday afternoon and a couple places had a very long wait. We got their last table (without waiting) and had an enjoyable lunch. I had one of their many burgers, wife had a deli sandwich, and grandson had chicken nuggets. The have a fantastic selection of brews, but we did not indulge. I had their sweet tea, which, unless I miss my guess, they sweeten with honey. Service was very attentive, to the point that they were very concerned by the grandson's sudden GI discomfort and loss of appetite. Try their special fries! And enjoy the extremely light-hearted atmosphere.

data.title: Fabulous food and beer!
data.text: Great local beers at a wicked good price. Amazing brisket sandwich. Side salad is a mixed greens salad that was so fresh it felt like it just came from a local garden. The good day burger was juicy and had a perfect egg on top. Very friendly staff and comfortable establishment.

data.title: Yummy, little place
data.text: Awesome beer selection, friendly service and tasty food. We love the bacon maple fries and truffle fries. The hummus is yummy and burgers are great!

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Quaint... unique... yummy! Good food and great service. Our booth had a street view, and the festival crowd outside added to the ambiance. Will be back!

data.title: Little Bar/Eatery on Strawberry Alley.
data.text: While at a convention at Riverview Inn, my mom and I decided to try this place, since it was a short walk from the hotel. I knew they served beer, and from the menu online, it looks like, salads, wraps, burgers, etc. When we arrived and went in, one of the servers greeted us and told us that we could sit anywhere. We chose a regular table and chairs not a booth. I ordered the Spinach Chicken Caesar Wrap with Sweet Potato Fries and my mother had the Turkey Salad. The food was great! The Wrap was so large that I could not even finish my fries! Everyone was nice and the whole place had a great laid back fun attitude. There is a bar where beer is served and is also dispensed in larger glass jugs. Old tin signs and posters align the walls. There are quite a few tables, but the place isn't huge. The owner's wife has a bakery across the street. The place was clean, well lit, but not overly crowded with items on the walls, etc. I would visit here again!

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: This is an excellent place to hang with friends to have great beer and outstanding food.  The owner was energetic and friendly.  The bacon maple sweet potatoes fries are a must!

data.title: Eclectic
data.text: Very good food, craft beer and friendly staff. Food took awhile but the atmosphere was great. Menu has burgers and sandwiches with a twist, which I like
